TextView.android:text: On each turn, the player can roll the dice up to three times to get the highest scoring combination for one of the 13 categories. After rolling, you must select a score or a zero in one of the 13 category boxes on your score card. The game ends when the players have selected all 13 boxes. The player with the highest total wins.

On your turn, you may roll the dice up to 3 times, although you may stop and score after your first or second roll. On your first roll you must roll all five dice. After, you can choose to reroll by pressing the roll button, or hold by selecting the ones you want to keep. When a dice is held, that dice will not be rolled if you choose to reroll.

When you decide to score, you must decide which box to fill in on your score card. There is a column of 13 boxes. You must select a score on each turn. Each category may be selected only once, besides a Yahtzee. The player will get a 100 points for every additional Yahtzee he or she gets.

There are also bonuses that you can qualify for. In the Upper Section (which includes the categories Aces through Sixes) you get a total score of more than 63 points then you will be rewarded with a 35 point bonus.
